column3: str
Jemime would have you reaffirm your desire to join the Goldsmiths' Guild.
The receptionist bids you present yourself to Serendipity, the young lady in charge of the guild. Seek her out and show her your burning desire to become a goldsmith.

Mistress Serendipity eagerly accepts you into the fold, and gifts you with a weathered chaser hammer. With the new tool of your trade in hand, speak to your guildmaster once more to begin your journey as a goldsmith.
Speak with Mistress Serendipity.
Before you can embark upon your journey to become a goldsmith, you must first seek an audience with our guildmaster. Are you ready to do so?
You shall find Mistress Serendipity on the workshop floor, just down the steps.
Show her your burning desire to learn, and you are certain to receive her permission to join.
Nervous, are we? I find slow, deep breaths calm the nerves. See if that works for you, and let me know when you are ready to meet the guildmaster.
Stop right there, you little troublemaker! People are working here!
Oh! Pardon me, I had you mistaken for a mammet. For a moment there I─
<sigh> Let's start over, shall we? What brings you here today, adventurer? Do you perchance have aspirations to become a goldsmith?
Have you aspirations to become a goldsmith?
Yes
No
Sorry, sorry. My mistake, it's been a long day. I don't ordinarily mind visitors, but I'm afraid I'm very busy at the moment. If you would excuse me...
<Emphasis>Really</Emphasis>!?
That's great! Welcome, <Emphasis>welcome</Emphasis>! I'm Serendipity, but you can call me Sera.
Or is that too informal?
Sorry, I'm still unaccustomed to this whole “guildmaster” business... Ah, right! What did you say your name was again? <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Adrian<Else/>Apollo</If>?

Oh, right─<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>! Well then, <Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>! Work hard and one day your creations may line the shelves at Eshtaime's Aesthetics. Trust in yourself and you can achieve anything!
That was sufficiently inspiring, I trust?
Good! Next order of business: here is your new chaser hammer. Well...I say new, but it's actually a bit weathered.
But never you mind that! Just show me that you know how to hold it so we can get started.
